content: I love that Kittery, Maine, and Portsmouth, New Hampshire area. Have been there many times and hope to call it home someday. I don't know about the employment situation. I hope fully this current economic cycle will improve and you will do very well.

content: [QUOTE]Originally posted by scpd3045: I love that Kittery, Maine, and Portsmouth, New Hampshire area. Have been there many times and hope to call it home someday. QUOTE] Well hey, if the NY Giants can play in New Jersey..... I grew up in Portsmouth and now live about 1/2 hour west of there. Brunswick is open for now, the Portsmouth Naval Ship was spared from closures as someone already said. There is also an ANG refueling wing still stationed at what was Pease AFB before they closed that. Now it's a public airport with the ANG wing still working out of there. Good timing if you're moving soon. It got up to near 90 degrees yesterday in Portsmouth. I know there is a VA Hospital in Manchester but I do not know where any others are located. Don
reply: [QUOTE]Originally posted by scpd3045: I love that Kittery, Maine, and Portsmouth, New Hampshire area. Have been there many times and hope to call it home someday. There is also an ANG refueling wing still stationed at what was Pease AFB before they closed that. Now it's a public airport with the ANG wing still working out of there. Good timing if you're moving soon. It got up to near 90 degrees yesterday in Portsmouth. I know there is a VA Hospital in Manchester but I do not know where any others are located. Don

content: Every Labor Day Pease Tradepark has a run sponsored by the nuns from a childrens hospital. The race ends up at the ANG where they have a BBQ. It's amazing realizing I parked in the same parking lot for this run as where I parked in 1972 when I was assigned there. I'll never skip that run as long as I'm alive. It also raises funds for a good cause.
reply: Every Labor Day Pease Tradepark has a run sponsored by the nuns from a childrens hospital. The race ends up at the ANG where they have a BBQ. title: Am Moving to NH

content: quote: Well hey, if the NY Giants can play in New Jersey. Let me tell you a thing or two about that Don. I was living in Hackensack, NJ. during the Giants move to The Medowlands. All us football fans were very excited about the Giants moving to NJ. We worked tirelessly to push through all the necessary legislation needed to make the move possible. Even going so far as to campaign for permission for them to destroy precious wetlands. We lived through years of heightened traffic gridlock while access roads were built and others widened and such. Rt3 was a nightmare for several years. In other words we did anything and everything we could to bring the Giants to NJ. How did the SOBs repay us? They wouldn't even rename the team the NJ Giants! It's like they took our kindness and wiped their bottoms with it. From that day on, My favorite NFL team is any team playing against the Giants. That also goes for a crowd of other NJ football fans. How come I pressed "One for English" and still can't understand a word the dude is saying?
quote: Well hey, if the NY Giants can play in New Jersey.
reply: Let me tell you a thing or two about that Don. I was living in Hackensack, NJ. during the Giants move to The Medowlands. All us football fans were very excited about the Giants moving to NJ. We worked tirelessly to push through all the necessary legislation needed to make the move possible. Even going so far as to campaign for permission for them to destroy precious wetlands. We lived through years of heightened traffic gridlock while access roads were built and others widened and such. Rt3 was a nightmare for several years. In other words we did anything and everything we could to bring the Giants to NJ. How did the SOBs repay us? They wouldn't even rename the team the NJ Giants! It's like they took our kindness and wiped their bottoms with it. From that day on, My favorite NFL team is any team playing against the Giants. That also goes for a crowd of other NJ football fans. How come I pressed "One for English" and still can't understand a word the dude is saying?
title: Am Moving to NH

content: One very good thing about that area, if you're eligible to take advantage of it: the best military health care comes from USFHP (Uniformed Services Family Health Plan, or Program, can't remember which) - a TRICARE-Prime equivalent. Reasonable in price (about $60/mo for a single), $3 pharmacy co-pay ($9 for non-generics), $12 doctor's office co-pay, $25 ER visit co-pay. I had it, in the WV/MD area, for the 15 years I was retired before I un-retired. If I return to that area, I hope to be able to re-enroll, though I'll be Medicare-eligible by then, so we'll have to see. I agree - beautiful area, and the Manchester airport is a little dandy. How come nobody mentioned great (sea)food??
reply: One very good thing about that area, if you're eligible to take advantage of it: the best military health care comes from USFHP (Uniformed Services Family Health Plan, or Program, can't remember which) - a TRICARE-Prime equivalent.
